Job Title: Property Manager

Location: Columbia, South Carolina Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Sales

Description:
The Property Manager for Gateway 737 will collaborate with the team on all aspects of operations before opening the project and will be involved in the initial lease-up, grand opening, and inaugural move-in. This individual will be responsible for integration of the accounting system and online leasing portal, hiring and training a strong marketing \ leasing and community ambassador team as well as the maintenance team. The Property Manager will implement all processes for day-to-day operations. The Property Manager will lead the team by example and work with residents and owners in a professional and service-oriented manner. This individual should enjoy working with a team and creating strategies to effectively reach leasing goals and objectives. The Property Manager is ultimately responsible for daily property operations and oversees leasing, property inspections, service requests, receivables collections, payables, and the preparation of the property budget.  
Holder Properties offers a competitive compensation package including base salary, discretionary bonus, paid time off, maternal/secondary partner leave, health benefits, as well as a 401K program with matching.
Ideal CandidateThis position may be for you if:The idea of an opening gets your excitement and creative juices flowing. Merch, anyone? You’re ready to set the tone, build a team, and create a welcoming ‘home’ for students at the University of South Carolina.You’re ready to create processes and standards and are committed to holding yourself and your team accountable for those standards.You know you can implement the big picture and execute all the details.You can't wait to get started.
Desired QualificationsA minimum of 4 years of multifamily property management experience is required; student housing experience preferredBachelors or Associates degree preferredPMIC property management certification requiredHigh proficiency with Microsoft productsExperience with Entrata, YARDI, or similar property management software requiredStrong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectivelyOrganizational and process skills to manage competing priorities with little supervision while being able to meet deadlines
Primary ResponsibilitiesOverall ResponsibilitiesDirect and participate in the daily operations of the property assuming responsibility for the performance of the property and the overall curb appealInterview, hire, and train team members – maintenance, leasing, and community ambassadorsConduct life safety training of personnel and residents. Coordinate evacuation training with the local fire department and residentsPromote professional and courteous resident and associate relations. Create training plans and property standard operating proceduresProvide team with training and hold themselves and all associates accountable for upholding position standards and creating a positive and professional service-oriented environmentConduct weekly staff meetings and monthly property management/budget meetings
Fiscal ResponsibilitiesDevelop the property budget for owner approval and operate the property within the approved budget.Make purchases for the property, submit purchase orders, and monitor all expenses at the property level.Oversee the collection process including deposits, rent, fees, and charges. Collect all funding and reimbursable collection items. Prepare monthly owner reports.
Leasing/Marketing ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with the corporate marketing team to develop and implement the marketing plan to generate optimum rental traffic to maximize occupancy.Achieve leasing/occupancy goals as well as tenant retention and renewal goals. Hire and manage the onsite leasing/marketing team to ensure the execution of marketing plans, social events, and ongoing promotions and activities. Collaborate with onsite leasing/marketing and corporate marketing team on a calendar of tenant experience events and offerings.Assist with social media content management for an on-brand social presence.
Facility/Maintenance ResponsibilitiesSupervise the maintenance team to ensure service requests are handled promptly. Regularly inspect the property, including close inspections of building equipment and operations with the maintenance team.Perform walk-through inspections with contractors.Negotiate and implement building service contracts with vendors. Follow up with the contractors regarding performance and recommendations for improved quality of service (janitorial, landscaping, turn vendors, etc.).Manage unit turnover and oversee maintenance team to maintain results within budgeted parameters.Perform apartment inspections monthly as well as before move-in and at move-out.
About Holder PropertiesFounded in 1980, Holder Properties is a full-service commercial real estate development and investment company. We offer all critical real estate functions—investment, development, management—under one roof. Throughout our history, we have developed or invested in multiple property types. While each type is unique, our broader approach is the same: We work to create environments where tenants and residents feel valued and know that their every need will be met. With our people-first approach to real estate, we build success on the foundation of relationships. That’s why keeping our word and developing trust are as important today as they were when we started four decades ago. Why Holder?1. We do what we say we'll do2. We are a small team with broad perspectives. 3. We are people-first4. We care.
Contact InformationChris SmithSenior Managing Director, Head of Management770.988.3126csmith@holderproperties.comwww.holderproperties.com

Experience Level (if available): None
